backlog.name: AI Voice Receptionist
backlog.detail:
Inbound call handling for riggers. Customer calls → Twilio → Gemini transcribes → Brain processes intent → routes to rigger or takes message.

Discussion notes:
• Use Twilio Programmable Voice for inbound
• Gemini for real-time transcription
• Brain engine classifies: urgent (mast down), booking request, quote enquiry, general
• SMS notification to rigger with summary
• Could become outbound too — appointment reminders

backlog.name: Field Conditions UX audit
backlog.notes: Sunlight contrast, glove-sized tap targets, offline mode, one-handed use
backlog.detail:
Optimise for real rigger working conditions:
• Bright sunlight — high contrast mode, increased text weight
• Thick gloves — all tap targets min 60-72px, no precision gestures
• Offline/patchy signal — queue writes locally, sync on reconnect
• Wind, rain, wet screen — large buttons, voice input primary, no swipe gestures

Priority area: inspection capture flow (FindingForm, observation entry, photo capture)

tasks.name: End-to-End System Test + scope v1
tasks.notes: Walk the complete flow, define what's v1-essential vs deferrable
tasks.detail:
This is both a test AND a scoping exercise. Walk through the complete lifecycle and at each step ask: does a rigger need this for v1?

Test path:
1. Create customer + boat
2. Start inspection → dictate findings → complete
3. Generate PDF report
4. Create job from inspection
5. Generate quote → send to portal
6. Customer approves via portal
7. Complete job → generate invoice

Scope questions:
• Is quoting v1-essential or do riggers just do the work and invoice?
• Is the customer portal v1-essential?
• Is scheduling v1-essential?

subtasks.name: Define v1 scope based on findings

• Wire InspectionSummary to use Brain for report generation

tasks.notes: Facebook → landing page → quiz → email nurture — worldwide
